result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek Gene Fredrickson in court.  Attorney Eric James Caudill in court for Derek Gene Fredrickson. Attorney Caudill stated there is also 21CF158 which has a plea date coming up in December, hoping to have a global resolution. Requested this case be set for the same date and time. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Court suggested Attorney Caudill get a date for a global at a separate time between now and December. 10:26 AM
